page.title: 06HOUSING IN TIDWORTH
page.content: The majority of housing in Tidworth is brick built and Ministry of Defence property. There is a large council estate at Pennings Road and a small estate between Ludgershall Road and Kennet Road,mainly occupied by retired people. The oldest Tidworth property is a 400 year old detached,flintstone built,thatched cottage. The first Army houses were built in 1903 but the majority were built in the 1960's. Married soldiers live mainly on the Matthew or Zouch Estates in the North of the village. The Officers' houses are in South Tidworth. Gardens tend to be small but there are large areas of open public space. Single soldiers live in the Barracks which were built at the beginning of the century. These are very overcrowded and are in the process of being replaced during a rebuilding programme.
